Designing a B2B app for Bosch startup spexor

T h e   p r o j e c t   c o n t e n t   c a n n o t   b e   p u b l i s h e d   h e r e   d u e   t o   N D A

P r o j e c t   o v e r v i e w

This project was developed as part of my bachelor's thesis in cooperation with the startup spexor. The goal of this project was to identify B2B customers' pain points with the spexor app in order to design a new interface for use in the B2B context.

Role:
Designer & Developer
Tools:
Sketch, Xcode
Duration:
12 weeks

B a c k g r o u n d

spexor was a startup within the Bosch Corporation, which is known as a global player for household appliances and mobility. spexor was a Bosch-branded product that uses smart sensor technology to warn of various (daily) dangers, such as burglaries or air pollution. spexor comprised an IoT device and a smartphone app that can be used to manage the device remotely.

spexor was designed for the B2C market. However, it has also been used internally at Bosch in a B2B context.

For this research, user interviews have been conducted to make sense of spexor how spexor is used in the business environment and to identify pain points. Based on the interviews, a detailed requirements catalogue (that contains both functional and non-functional) has been established.

P r o c e s s

The project comprised:

  • User Interviews
  • Requirements & Priorisation
  • Wireframing
  • Rapid Prototyping
  • Testing

L e a r n i n g s

spexor was my first experience working with a real-world product.

Joining spexor shortly after its market release, I was involved in the product development process.

During my two years at spexor, I was able to gain experience in the startup as well as corporate environment.
